definition: to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: The fragmentations of teacher beliefs were eventually damage education hope.
sentences.chinese: 教师信奉的支离破碎最终则损毁了教育的希望。

sentences.english: The surveyor’s report indicates that there has been some serious damage to some of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 商检报告显示有一些货物遭到了严重的损毁。

sentences.english: Any loss or destroy of the membership card, $50 compensative procedures fee shall be given.
sentences.chinese: 会员卡如有遗失或损毁，补领手续为每张港币50元。

sentences.english: Seals affixed by the Customs shall not be opened or broken by any person without Customs authorization.
sentences.chinese: 海关加施的封志，任何人不得擅自开启或损毁。

sentences.english: This coupon will become invalid if defaced or damaged and is not replaceable once lost or damaged.
sentences.chinese: 本劵不设报失，逾期使用或损毁均作无效。

sentences.english: There have been no reports of significant damage or of fatalities.
sentences.chinese: 目前暂无严重损毁或伤亡报导。

sentences.english: The service condition and wear mechanisms of RH submerged tube castables are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了RH浸渍管浇注料的使用条件和损毁机理。

sentences.english: He maliciously damaged a car with a baseball bat.
sentences.chinese: 他用棒球棒恶意损毁了一辆汽车。

sentences.english: Check the pins and if there is any damage clean or possibly replace the terminals.
sentences.chinese: 检查销子，如果有任何损毁，进行清洗或者更换终端。

sentences.english: A: Our last order arrived damaged because of the packaging.
sentences.chinese: 上次叫的货因为包装太差送到后都损毁了。

sentences.english: Wrecked equipment and materiel of all kinds lies strewn around as the crossing is made.
sentences.chinese: 此时，各种损毁的设备和物资杂乱的散布于各处。

sentences.english: Christchurch airport was closed and The Press building, a center for newspapers, was badly damaged.
sentences.chinese: 基督城机场已经关闭，新闻大厦也受到严重损毁。

sentences.english: The ground is never destructed by the vehicles and doesn’t need any reconstruction.
sentences.chinese: 该地面从未被任何交通工具损毁，也不需要任何重修。

sentences.english: The cash coupons are not replaceable in case of loss or damage.
sentences.chinese: 现金券如有遗失或损毁，恕不补发。

sentences.english: Close to 100 nearby homes were levelled or severely damaged.
sentences.chinese: 附近有近100所民房被夷平或是严重损毁。

sentences.english: No person may, without authorization, open or damage the seals affixed by the Customs.
sentences.chinese: 海关加施的封志，任何人不得擅自开启或者损毁。

definition: to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to blow up/to destroy with explosives
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
